name: fault-parameter
description: Represents BACnet Fault Parameter, which defines the parameters for fault detection algorithms in BACnet objects. Each choice option corresponds to a specific fault type and contains the criteria for detecting that fault condition.

options.name: none
options.description: No fault parameter specified.

options.name: fault-characterstring
options.description: Fault parameters for character string value monitoring, triggered when a string matches one of the specified fault values.

fields.name: list-of-fault-values
fields.description: A list of character string values that indicate a fault condition.

options.name: fault-extended
options.description: Fault parameters for vendor-specific extended fault detection, allowing custom fault algorithms beyond standard BACnet fault types.

fields.name: vendor-id
fields.description: The vendor identifier for the vendor-specific fault type.

fields.name: parameters

options.name: null
options.description: No parameter value.

options.name: real
options.description: A real number parameter.

options.name: unsigned
options.description: An unsigned integer parameter.

options.name: boolean
options.description: A boolean parameter.

options.name: integer
options.description: A signed integer parameter.

options.name: double
options.description: A double-precision floating-point parameter.

options.name: octetstring
options.description: An octet string parameter.

options.name: characterstring
options.description: A character string parameter.

options.name: bitstring
options.description: A bit string parameter.

options.name: enumerated
options.description: An enumerated value parameter.

options.name: date
options.description: A date parameter.

options.name: time
options.description: A time parameter.

options.name: objectidentifier
options.description: A BACnet object identifier parameter.

options.name: reference
options.description: A device object property reference parameter.

fields.description: A series of parameters for the extended fault type, which can be of various data types.

options.name: fault-life-safety
options.description: Fault parameters for life safety state monitoring, triggered when a life safety object enters one of the specified fault states.

fields.name: list-of-fault-values
fields.description: A list of life safety states that indicate a fault condition.

fields.name: mode-property-reference
fields.description: Reference to the mode property that affects fault detection.

options.name: fault-state
options.description: Fault parameters for property state monitoring, triggered when a state property matches one of the specified fault states.

fields.name: list-of-fault-values
fields.description: A list of property states that indicate a fault condition.

options.name: fault-status-flags
options.description: Fault parameters for status flags monitoring, triggered when specific status flags are set in a referenced property.

fields.name: status-flags-reference
fields.description: Reference to the status flags property to be monitored.

options.name: fault-out-of-range
options.description: Fault parameters for out-of-range monitoring, triggered when a numeric value falls outside the specified normal range.

fields.name: min-normal-value

options.name: real
options.description: Minimum normal value as a real number.

options.name: unsigned
options.description: Minimum normal value as an unsigned integer.

options.name: double
options.description: Minimum normal value as a double-precision number.

options.name: integer
options.description: Minimum normal value as a signed integer.

fields.description: The minimum value of the normal operating range.

fields.name: max-normal-value

options.name: real
options.description: Maximum normal value as a real number.

options.name: unsigned
options.description: Maximum normal value as an unsigned integer.

options.name: double
options.description: Maximum normal value as a double-precision number.

options.name: integer
options.description: Maximum normal value as a signed integer.

fields.description: The maximum value of the normal operating range.

options.name: fault-listed
options.description: Fault parameters for list monitoring, triggered when a monitored value appears in a referenced fault list.

fields.name: fault-list-reference
fields.description: Reference to the property containing the list of fault values.
